Description: Body sherd of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two faded added white bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '24' is written in pencil on the interior surface. According to Williams (1983, 184, note 53), this sherd belongs with British Museum 1924,1201.771, not with 1924,1201.821 as claimed by Cook and Woodhead (1952, 169 no. 170); the latter is of substantially thinner fabric. Many kantharoi Type B (See Williams 1983, 169) have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 181)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 730, no. 905)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1712) (phase 2)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 184 note 53)
